item.title: Weekly Tuesday Sit & Dharma Talk
item.description:
Our core weekly gathering. We begin with 30 minutes of silent meditation, followed by a talk on “The Second Noble Truth: The Cause of Suffering”.

Schedule

  • 6:45 PM - Optional meditation instruction for beginners
  • 7:00 PM - Silent sitting meditation (30 minutes)
  • 7:30 PM - Dharma talk or discussion
  • 8:00 PM - Tea and open discussion

All levels of experience are welcome. Cushions and chairs are provided. No special clothing needed.

item.title: Daily Practice Struggles
item.description:
How do you all maintain a 20-minute daily sit when the kids are home? I’ve been struggling to find consistent time in the mornings before work.

I’ve tried:

  • Waking up 30 minutes earlier (hard when the kids wake up early too)
  • Sitting in the evening (I’m too tired)
  • Short 10-minute sits (helpful but not the same)

Would love to hear what works for other parents in the sangha.

item.title: New Library Books Available
item.description:
We have added five new titles to our community library, including Pema Chödrön’s latest work on living with compassion and uncertainty.

New titles include:

  • Living Beautifully with Uncertainty and Change by Pema Chödrön
  • The Art of Gathering by Priya Krishna
  • Stillness Speaks by Eckhart Tolle

Feel free to browse and borrow after our Tuesday meetings. Our library is a free resource for all sangha members.

item.title: About the Sangha
item.description:
Sangha: The Buddhist Community

A Buddhist community that meets to meditate together and study the dharma, the teachings of the Buddha.

The Eau Claire Buddhist Sangha is a peer-led sangha, with occasional guidance from teachers in the Vipassana and Zen traditions of Buddhism. Everyone is welcome, whether you study and practice in a particular lineage of Buddhism or practice with another faith tradition. Participants come from all walks of life and all faith traditions.
